Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions

= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals|= innermost room at the back of the main temple building; ► location of the ark of the covenant; ≈ regarded as the most holy place
= relation linking a proposition to a location: the part of an object that is visible from the perspective of someone located within that object

= a relatively large piece of cloth, woven by a craftsman with costly materials, ► separating the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place in the sanctuary, and covering the Ark of the Covenant when it was being moved

Node.gloss: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
Node.definition: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the Covenant Box (אֲרֹון) which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= wooden box, overlaid with gold and with a golden cover with cherubs, normally placed behind the veil in the tabernacle or temple, but also carried along during military campaigns; ► symbolizing the presence of YHWH among his people and used to store the two tablets with the law of God and other objects representing important events in the history of Israel
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye

Node.gloss: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
Node.definition: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the Covenant Box (אֲרֹון) which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)
= the tabernacle or temple of YHWH, described in terms of its holiness
= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such
= direct offspring of animals, either male or indeterminate

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth
= action by which a human being performs the sacrificial ritual that is intended to remove the state of guilt from oneself or someone else

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

= an undergarment, ◄ woven of linen, ► and worn by the High Priest and his fellow priests; it was worn over the breeches (מִכְנָס) but from the waist up it was next to the skin; it was a kind of shirt and probably had long sleeves and reached nearly to the ankles and was held in place by a sash wound around the waist.

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
= undergarment covering the lower part of the naked body

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person
= strip ◄ of cloth ► worn around the waist as part of one's uniform

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

Node.gloss: to gird oneself|to put on (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = action by which someone ties a belt or piece of cloth around the waist; hence also: to put on clothes or armor

= a headpiece formed by winding a long piece of cloth many times around the top of the head; it may have been wound permanently and put on and taken off like a hat; ► worn by priests, but also by kings

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= causative action by which humans wind a cloth around their head
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: to take a bath|to bathe|to wash
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which a countable entity is two in number

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

= a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten
= action by which a human being performs the sacrificial ritual that is intended to remove the state of guilt from oneself or someone else

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such
= action by which a human being performs the sacrificial ritual that is intended to remove the state of guilt from oneself or someone else
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten
= specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

= specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger

= a certain quantity that fill a certain container
= container; ◄ made out of bronze or gold; ► used for carrying burning coals or burning wicks for lamps

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container
= two hands joined together in the shape of a bowl; ◄ part of the human body
= substance ◄ made from tree gum or bark ► to make a sweet smell; it is burned in a censer or on an open fire ≈ to provide a sweet aroma pleasing to God
= state in which an object has opposite surface or sides relatively close together
= relation linking a proposition to a location: the part of an object that is visible from the perspective of someone located within that object

= a relatively large piece of cloth, woven by a craftsman with costly materials, ► separating the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place in the sanctuary, and covering the Ark of the Covenant when it was being moved

Node.gloss: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
Node.definition: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the Covenant Box (אֲרֹון) which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

Node.gloss: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
Node.definition: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the Covenant Box (אֲרֹון) which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement

Node.gloss: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
Node.definition: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the Covenant Box (אֲרֹון) which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation
= the tabernacle or temple of YHWH, described in terms of its holiness

= something that causes humans, animals, or objects to be regarded by the law as having been contaminated, as a result of which anything that touches them may become contaminated as well; ► humans, animals, and objects that are unclean cannot participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= something that causes humans, animals, or objects to be regarded by the law as having been contaminated, as a result of which anything that touches them may become contaminated as well; ► humans, animals, and objects that are unclean cannot participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation
= the tabernacle or temple of YHWH, described in terms of its holiness
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten
= projection in the form of the horn of an animal; ◄ located at each of the four corners of the altar
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are necessary ► for rendering people and places free from contamination, as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the places can be put to normal use
= causative action by where humans cause other humans or objects to be ready to be in the presence of a deity by going through special rituals

= something that causes humans, animals, or objects to be regarded by the law as having been contaminated, as a result of which anything that touches them may become contaminated as well; ► humans, animals, and objects that are unclean cannot participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which deities, humans, or animals bring an activity to full completion
= causative action by which priests remove uncleanness from a sanctuary and its furnishings by performing the rituals that are required to achieve that, so that they can function again as they should

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the tabernacle or temple of YHWH, described in terms of its holiness

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to lay (one's hand on)|to rest (one's hand on)
Node.definition: = action by which humans put their hand(s) on another human, an animal, or an object ► often as a ritual before sacrifice or a sign of authority or punishment
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
= state by which humans have been prepared for a particular task
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
literally: to hold; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well being of others

= a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a piece of land that is inaccessible, as if physically detached from its surroundings
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
= the tabernacle or temple of YHWH, described in terms of its holiness

= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
literally: to humble (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans refrain from ingesting food ► and so humiliate themselves before a deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= person born in the land, as opposed to the resident alien (גֵּר)

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are necessary ► for rendering people and places free from contamination, as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the places can be put to normal use

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be clean|to be ceremonially clean|to be ritually clean
Node.definition: = state in which people or objects are considered free from contamination, ► as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the objects can be put to normal use
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
literally: to humble (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans refrain from ingesting food ► and so humiliate themselves before a deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= pattern of behavior required from someone by somebody in authority
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which someone in authority confers the office of priest, king, or prophet on another person, by pouring oil on that person's head

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to ordain|to install in office|to consecrate
Node.definition: literally: to fill (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which someone ordains another person to be a priest

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to fill (someone's) hand; hence: = causative action by which humans ordain other humans to the office of priest or a similar role

Node.gloss: to act as priest|to serve as priest
Node.definition: = state in which humans have been ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to function as a priest (כֹּהֵן)
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= generic designation for any article of clothing

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= causative action by which priests remove uncleanness from a sanctuary and its furnishings by performing the rituals that are required to achieve that, so that they can function again as they should

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= central part of sanctuary which is considered more holy than the rest and therefore accessible to priests only
= the tabernacle or temple of YHWH, described in terms of its holiness

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= causative action by which priests remove uncleanness from a sanctuary and its furnishings by performing the rituals that are required to achieve that, so that they can function again as they should
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation
= pattern of behavior required from someone by somebody in authority
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= causative action by which a priest performs the rituals that are required to remove guilt or uncleanness from people or objects, which usually requires a blood sacrifice, or another form of compensation
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
